title: Dragonkin Conflicts

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Dragonkin Conflicts were a series of attacks by the Necrosyrtes, a group of Dragonkin who spread terror to cool their rage. The attacks started immediately after the God Wars and lasted for approximately a hundred years.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dragonkin conflicts

The Dragonkin Conflicts were a series of attacks by the Necrosyrtes, a group of Dragonkin who spread terror to cool their rage. The attacks started immediately after the God Wars and lasted for approximately a hundred years.

After the abuse of the Stone of Jas by Saradomin and Zamorak during the God Wars, the Dragonkin, unable to stop them, were tortured by Jas' curse and thus cooled their rage by attacking human settlements as the Fourth Age began.[1] Being largely resistant to conventional weapons, the Dragonkin were left unchecked.

During the Conflicts, many fled far west to Zeah, and founded Hosidius and Shayzien.[2]

Contents

  • 1 Turning the tide
  • 2 Dragonkin experiments
  • 3 Battle on Lithkren
  • 4 Further Conflicts
  • 5 Zorgoth's release
  • 6 References

Turning the tide[edit | edit source]

As the conflicts escalated, humans found a way to harm the Dragonkin via weapons from Kethsi, and begun to turn the tide on the battle.[3] Seeing this, Zorgoth, a Dragonkin, began to perform experiments with other Dragonkin on dragons, who were bred from lizards infused with the lifeblood of Dragonkin. Their aim was to turn the tide of the war back in their favour, by creating dragons possessing greater strength and aggression by injecting them with spores from certain fungi.[4] The first of these experiments took place in a laboratory on Crandor, where they had succeeded in giving a green dragon heightened aggression after hundreds of trials.[5]

Dragonkin experiments[edit | edit source]

As their experiments continued, they had moved to a different laboratory, this time on Ungael.[6] Here, they had changed the test subjects from green dragons to blue dragons.[7] This resulted in the creation of at least two vorkath - they had increased strength, but were even less aggressive, most likely as a result of their undead nature. Zorgoth destroyed one of them in a rage during an unknown incident.[8] As the operation grew larger, he ordered the construction of the Lithkren Vault on Lithkren.[9] Eventually, human forces discovered the island, prompting Zorgoth to abandon the island, keeping the remaining vorkath there to serve as an obstacle.[10]

Battle on Lithkren[edit | edit source]

Aivas, Tristan, Odysseus, Robert the Strong, and Camorra confronting a dragonkin on Lithkren.

On Lithkren, their largest laboratory, they continued their experiments, abducting creatures such as demons, giants and spectres as well.[11] This eventually attracted the attention of heroes Robert the Strong, Aivas, Camorra Shayzien and Tristan Corvo after sailors spotted an island with Dragonkin architecture as they were forced to take different routes.[12] The four led an assault on the island, where they eventually encountered a Dragonkin by a set of grandiose doors. The Dragonkin was slain by the four heroes, but not before creature was able to kill Aivas.

This assault enacted the emergency protocol in the Vault, which placed it in lock-down, trapping Zorgoth within.[13]

Fearing what may lie behind the doors,[14] the heroes decided to split the dragon key that the dragonkin left behind, and hid the pieces around the world.[15] Robert hid two key pieces in Ungael and the Karamjan Temple in the Kharazi Jungle, Tristan buried one key piece in Mort Myre Swamp, and Camorra travelled far west to Zeah, eventually founding Shayzien.[16] After her death, she hid her key piece in her coffin in the lowest level of the Shayzien Crypts.

Further Conflicts[edit | edit source]

Robert fights against a dragonkin.

After the battle on Lithkren, the conflict between the Dragonkin and humans continued. At one point in the war, Robert and his panther, Odysseus, managed to reach Dragonkin Castle and confront another Dragonkin. During the fight that ensued, Odysseus was killed by the Dragonkin. Robert nearly died as well, but he ultimately managed to kill the wounded Dragonkin.

The conflicts between the Dragonkin and humans eventually ended sometime after this battle.

Zorgoth's release[edit | edit source]

Zorgoth is released from the Vault after nearly two thousand years.

During the Fifth Age two thousand years later, an adventurer and Dallas Jones, an expert on dragons, unwittingly opened the Lithkren Vault, whose key was split by the Fourth Age heroes long ago, and freed Zorgoth.

During his imprisonment, he had managed to perfect the ultimate weapon. The weapon was Galvek, a dragon with elemental powers and the ability to control the minds of other dragons.[17] With the Vault unsealed, Zorgoth left the vault, after killing Dallas, and began to gather the world's dragons to Ungael in order to launch an assault on the human kingdoms.

An adventurer faces Galvek.

Seeing the threat that Zorgoth posed to the world, the kingdoms of Gielinor, namely Asgarnia, Misthalin, Kandarin, as well as the Fremennik Province, Burthorpe, and Camelot, stood united against the dragonkin threat, and planned an assault on Ungael.

The assault was a success, resulting in the deaths of Galvek and Zorgoth, but not without many casualties from the united kingdoms, and Bob the Cat.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Zorgoth, "Dragon Slayer II", Old School RuneScape. "Only a few gave in to the anger of the curse. Only a few waged war on you."
  2. ↑ Imerominia, "Dragon Slayer II", Old School RuneScape. "Hosidius and Shayzien were the two cities founded during the Dragonkin Conflicts."
  3. ↑ Lithkren vault notes, written by Zorgoth, page 5, Old School RuneScape. "...our kind was immune to their weapons for so long that we allowed ourselves to become reckless. A foolish mistake. We'd heard of the Necrosyrtes who had fallen on Kethsi. We should have known the humans would find those weapons. But we were arrogant and by the time we realised it, it was too late."
  4. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 2, Old School RuneScape. "For so long we have been tweaking the spores to no effect."
  5. ↑ Old notes, written by Zorgoth, Old School RuneScape. "Hundreds of trials have been performed, so many that I have lost count. ... The subject displayed heightened aggression, as desired. However, its strength is unchanged and its mental capacity is limited."
  6. ↑ Old notes, written by Zorgoth, Old School RuneScape. "Our work has outgrown this small facility [on Crandor], it is time to move on."
  7. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 2, Old School RuneScape. "For this trial, I decided we should change the subject instead. Green has failed us so far, maybe Blue will have better results."
  8. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 7, Old School RuneScape. "But once again, it was a disappointment. The strength in this one was phenomenal, a true sight to behold. However, it lacked the aggression needed. It was another vorkath, a pathetic failure. I should have let it live, a beast that strong would likely have still had a use. However, my anger got the better of me, and I destroyed it."
  9. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 5, Old School RuneScape. "As our operation grows, I feel we will soon need even more room to work. To that end, I have ordered the construction of a new facility, this one on Lithkren itself."
  10. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 9, Old School RuneScape. "Human forces are on the move. We don't know how they found the island, but that is irrelevant now. Luckily for us, the new facility is ready. I've ordered that all important materials be transported there at once. In the meantime, I intend to provide the humans with a little distraction. Seems like the vorkath will have a use after all."
  11. ↑ Aivas' diary, written by Aivas, page 1, Old School RuneScape. "One of the scouts came back today with a disturbing report. He claimed that he had seen the enemy abducting various beasts from the caves north of Karville. Demons, giants and spectres were just some of the ones he mentioned."
  12. ↑ Aivas' diary, written by Aivas, page 2-3, Old School RuneScape. "sailors have been having to brave more treacherous waters. While navigating the rarely travelled northern seas, they spotted an unmapped group of islands to the east. They claimed that one of the islands was the home of a large fortress, one built in the distinct architecture of the kin."
  13. ↑ Ungael lab notes, written by Zorgoth, page 2, Old School RuneScape. "Another setback, once again the humans are responsible. They found the island and launched an attack. As planned, the emergency protocol was enacted and the vault was sealed, unfortunately, I was still inside it when this happened."
  14. ↑ Robert the Strong, "Dragon Slayer II", Old School RuneScape. "That dragonkin mentioned a weapon, one that could destroy us all. Betters something like that remains hidden."
  15. ↑ Bob, "Dragon Slayer II", Old School RuneScape. "After the battle, myself, Tristan and Camorra split the key into four pieces"
  16. ↑ Camorra's tomb, Old School RuneScape. "Here lies Camorra Shayzien // Founder of Shayzien House."
  17. ↑ Zorgoth, "Dragon Slayer II", Old School RuneScape. "Yes. [Galvek] has power that no other dragon has. The power to influence the minds of other dragons. Through him, an army will be raised. One that will annihilate humanity."

{{External|rs=Dragonkin conflicts}}
The '''Dragonkin Conflicts''' were a series of attacks by the Necrosyrtes, a group of [[Dragonkin]] who spread terror to cool their rage. The attacks started immediately after the [[God Wars]] and lasted for approximately a hundred years.

After the abuse of the [[Stone of Jas]] by [[Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak]] during the God Wars, the Dragonkin, unable to stop them, were tortured by [[Jas]]' curse and thus cooled their rage by attacking human settlements as the [[Fourth Age]] began.{{CiteNPC|npc=Zorgoth|loc=Dragon Slayer II|quote=Only a few gave in to the anger of the curse. Only a few waged war on you.}} Being largely resistant to conventional weapons, the Dragonkin were left unchecked.

During the Conflicts, many fled far west to [[Zeah]], and founded [[Hosidius]] and [[Shayzien]].{{CiteNPC|npc=Imerominia|loc=Dragon Slayer II|quote=Hosidius and Shayzien were the two cities founded during the Dragonkin Conflicts.}}

==Turning the tide==
As the conflicts escalated, humans found a way to harm the Dragonkin via weapons from Kethsi, and begun to turn the tide on the battle.{{CiteText|text=Lithkren vault notes|author=Zorgoth|page=5|quote=...our kind was immune to their weapons for so long that we allowed ourselves to become reckless. A foolish mistake. We'd heard of the Necrosyrtes who had fallen on Kethsi. We should have known the humans would find those weapons. But we were arrogant and by the time we realised it, it was too late.}} Seeing this, [[Zorgoth]], a Dragonkin, began to perform experiments with other Dragonkin on [[dragons]], who were bred from lizards infused with the lifeblood of Dragonkin. Their aim was to turn the tide of the war back in their favour, by creating dragons possessing greater strength and aggression by injecting them with spores from certain fungi.{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=2|quote=For so long we have been tweaking the spores to no effect.}} The first of these experiments took place in a laboratory on [[Crandor]], where they had succeeded in giving a [[Elvarg|green dragon]] heightened aggression after hundreds of trials.{{CiteText|text=Old notes (Dragon Slayer II)#Crandor{{!}}Old notes|author=Zorgoth|quote=Hundreds of trials have been performed, so many that I have lost count. ... The subject displayed heightened aggression, as desired. However, its strength is unchanged and its mental capacity is limited.}}

==Dragonkin experiments==
As their experiments continued, they had moved to a different laboratory, this time on [[Ungael]].{{CiteText|text=Old notes (Dragon Slayer II)#Crandor{{!}}Old notes|author=Zorgoth|quote=Our work has outgrown this small facility [on Crandor], it is time to move on.}} Here, they had changed the test subjects from green dragons to [[blue dragon]]s.{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=2|quote=For this trial, I decided we should change the subject instead. Green has failed us so far, maybe Blue will have better results.}} This resulted in the creation of at least two [[vorkath]] - they had increased strength, but were even less aggressive, most likely as a result of their undead nature. Zorgoth destroyed one of them in a rage during an unknown incident.{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=7|quote=But once again, it was a disappointment. The strength in this one was phenomenal, a true sight to behold. However, it lacked the aggression needed. It was another vorkath, a pathetic failure. I should have let it live, a beast that strong would likely have still had a use. However, my anger got the better of me, and I destroyed it.}} As the operation grew larger, he ordered the construction of the [[Lithkren Vault]] on [[Lithkren]].{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=5|quote=As our operation grows, I feel we will soon need even more room to work. To that end, I have ordered the construction of a new facility, this one on Lithkren itself.}} Eventually, human forces discovered the island, prompting Zorgoth to abandon the island, keeping the remaining vorkath there to serve as an obstacle.{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=9|quote=Human forces are on the move. We don't know how they found the island, but that is irrelevant now. Luckily for us, the new facility is ready. I've ordered that all important materials be transported there at once. In the meantime, I intend to provide the humans with a little distraction. Seems like the vorkath will have a use after all.}}

==Battle on Lithkren==
[[File:Dragon Slayer II - confronting dragonkin.png|thumb|300px|[[Aivas]], [[Tristan]], [[Odysseus]], [[Robert the Strong]], and [[Camorra]] confronting a [[Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II)|dragonkin]] on [[Lithkren]].]]
On [[Lithkren]], their largest laboratory, they continued their experiments, abducting creatures such as demons, giants and spectres as well.{{CiteText|text=Aivas' diary|author=Aivas|page=1|quote=One of the scouts came back today with a disturbing report. He claimed that he had seen the enemy abducting various beasts from the caves north of Karville. Demons, giants and spectres were just some of the ones he mentioned.}} This eventually attracted the attention of heroes [[Robert the Strong]], [[Aivas]], [[Camorra Shayzien]] and [[Tristan Corvo]] after sailors spotted an island with Dragonkin architecture as they were forced to take different routes.{{CiteText|text=Aivas' diary|author=Aivas|page=2-3|quote=sailors have been having to brave more treacherous waters. While navigating the rarely travelled northern seas, they spotted an unmapped group of islands to the east. They claimed that one of the islands was the home of a large fortress, one built in the distinct architecture of the kin.}} The four led an assault on the island, where they eventually encountered a [[Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II)|Dragonkin]] by a set of [[grandiose doors]]. The Dragonkin was slain by the four heroes, but not before creature was able to kill [[Aivas]]. 

This assault enacted the emergency protocol in the Vault, which placed it in lock-down, trapping Zorgoth within.{{CiteText|text=Ungael lab notes|author=Zorgoth|page=2|quote=Another setback, once again the humans are responsible. They found the island and launched an attack. As planned, the emergency protocol was enacted and the vault was sealed, unfortunately, I was still inside it when this happened.}}

Fearing what may lie behind the doors,{{CiteNPC|npc=Robert the Strong|loc=Dragon Slayer II|quote=That dragonkin mentioned a weapon, one that could destroy us all. Betters something like that remains hidden.}} the heroes decided to split the [[dragon key]] that the dragonkin left behind, and hid the [[dragon key pieces|pieces]] around the world.{{CiteNPC|npc=Bob|loc=Dragon Slayer II|quote=After the battle, myself, Tristan and Camorra split the key into four pieces}} [[Robert the Strong|Robert]] hid two key pieces in [[Ungael]] and the [[Karamjan Temple]] in the [[Kharazi Jungle]], [[Tristan]] buried one key piece in [[Mort Myre Swamp]], and [[Camorra]] travelled far west to [[Zeah]], eventually founding [[Shayzien]].{{CiteText|text=Tomb (Dragon Slayer II){{!}}Camorra's tomb|quote=Here lies Camorra Shayzien // Founder of Shayzien House.}} After her death, she hid her key piece in her coffin in the lowest level of the [[Shayzien Crypts]].

==Further Conflicts==
[[File:A Tail of Two Cats - Robert vs the Dragonkin.png|thumb|210px|Robert fights against a dragonkin.]]
After the battle on Lithkren, the conflict between the Dragonkin and humans continued. At one point in the war, Robert and his panther, [[Odysseus]], managed to reach [[Dragonkin Castle]] and confront another [[Dragonkin (A Tail of Two Cats)|Dragonkin]]. During the fight that ensued, Odysseus was killed by the Dragonkin. Robert nearly died as well, but he ultimately managed to kill the wounded Dragonkin.

The conflicts between the Dragonkin and humans eventually ended sometime after this battle.

==Zorgoth's release==
[[File:Dragon Slayer II - Zorgoth appears.png|thumb|left|210px|Zorgoth is released from the Vault after nearly two thousand years.]]
During the [[Fifth Age]] two thousand years later, an adventurer and [[Dallas Jones]], an expert on dragons, unwittingly opened the [[Lithkren Vault]], whose key was split by the Fourth Age heroes long ago, and freed [[Zorgoth]].

During his imprisonment, he had managed to perfect the ultimate weapon. The weapon was [[Galvek]], a dragon with elemental powers and the ability to control the minds of other dragons.{{CiteNPC|npc=Zorgoth|loc=Dragon Slayer II|quote=Yes. [Galvek] has power that no other dragon has. The power to influence the minds of other dragons. Through him, an army will be raised. One that will annihilate humanity.}} With the Vault unsealed, Zorgoth left the vault, after killing Dallas, and began to gather the world's dragons to [[Ungael]] in order to launch an assault on the human kingdoms.
[[File:Dragon Slayer II - Galvek's tsunami.png|thumb|210px|An adventurer faces Galvek.]]
Seeing the threat that Zorgoth posed to the world, the kingdoms of Gielinor, namely [[Asgarnia]], [[Misthalin]], [[Kandarin]], as well as the [[Fremennik Province]], [[Burthorpe]], and [[Camelot]], stood united against the dragonkin threat, and planned an assault on [[Ungael]].

The assault was a success, resulting in the deaths of [[Galvek]] and [[Zorgoth]], but not without many casualties from the united kingdoms, and [[Bob the Cat]].
